comments.body: I wonder why you don't change the code on line 172, just changing the doc @feihujiang

@WIZARD-CXY Because I know PodNetworkStatus struct represents version "v1" which is defined at https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/pkg/kubelet/network/plugins.go#L60, so I changed the doc. But I'm not familiar with the module of networkplugin, and maybe I didn't notice the code of line 172, so I don't change the code.
I will finish it, haha
Yes, go on.
I think this change is wrong

This struct represents version "v1" which is noted at https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/pkg/kubelet/network/plugins.go#L60
What's this note mean or just a wrong note?

Design: Why is this a periodic pull rather than something returned from SetUpPod() ?  Is there the expectation that a pod can change IPs after creation?  That might break a number of other components like the Service->Endpoint generation loop (not sure).

At this point we are just following the model of how container runtime is called and then IP address is obtained from the regular Status calls.

I am expecting that at some point this Status call will include policy structures too, or custom info about the network configuration of the pod (see #12170)
I'm OK with it, just wanted to understand.  I'm a little concerned about overhead, but let's just keep an eye on it.
This is OK for now, but we should really unmarshal into a TypeMeta, check the version and kind, and then unmarshal into a versioned object.  We can do that when we have a second version :)

Add one more comment to the effect of "If the pod infra container self-terminates (e.g. crashes or is killed), the entire pod lifecycle will be restarted, but teardown will not be called".  Is this OK?  Or do you still want to call teardown in this case?
Also what FDs are open and what happens to stdout and stderr

@errordeveloper made a good point (can't find the comment in GutHub's lovely UI) - should this be configurable?  We can do that after the fact, but maybe passing the dir as an argument to exec.ProbeNetworkPlugins() and exposing it as a kubelet flag.
It doesn't stop with IP. How about vlan, default gateway and netmask (if IP is not in cidr format)?
This comment seems misplaced - to what did you intend to respond?

@thockin 

I meant to respond to @errordeveloper about returning IP address from plugin. Sorry was off by one. If kubelet is provisioning the pod based on what the plugin responds with, it should be more than just the IP address.
minor: you could use util.SplitQualifiedName()

Doesn't that one assume a single '/' ? 
What if the vendored name is myproduct/v2/sdn . What we want is sdn and not v2.
qualified name does assume a single / - if we want to change that we want to change it all over.
FWIW you already test for IsQualifiedName() (which is correct)
